spec.name: Abdelwahab Doukkali Small Museum
spec.description: The Petit Musuee Abdelwahab Doukkali is a unique cultural space located on the 17th floor of the historic 'Immeuble Liberte' (also known as the '17eme etage' building), designed by Swiss architect Leonard Rene Morandi, in the heart of Casablanca. It serves as a personal museum and 'place of memory' for the renowned Moroccan artist Abdelwahab Doukkali, a legend of Moroccan cultural heritage known for his contributions to music, composition, acting, cinema, drawing, and painting. The museum houses his personal collections, including photos, medals, albums, and even sentimental items like his father's watch. It aims to tell a fragment of his autobiography and offers a vibrant space for art and culture. Beyond permanent displays, the museum actively hosts temporary exhibitions, literary gatherings, and intimate concerts, fostering a dynamic environment for young artists and promoting Moroccan cultural heritage.

people.comment: Renowned Moroccan singer, composer, actor, luthist, painter, and draughtsman. He transformed his own apartment into this museum, dedicated to his life and work, and preserving Moroccan cultural memory.
Swiss architect who designed the 'Immeuble Liberte' building, where the museum is located.

timeline.title: Immeuble Liberte Construction
timeline.description: The museum is housed in the historic 'Immeuble Liberte' (17-story building), a significant architectural landmark in Casablanca.

timeline.title: Museum Opening
timeline.description: The Petit Musee Abdelwahab Doukkali officially opened its doors to the public on May 21, 2023.

timeline.title: Apartment converted into Museum
timeline.description: Abdelwahab Doukkali initiated the conversion of his apartment into a museum, aiming to preserve his legacy.
